head.title: Karen Cannon, Marc de Saint Phalle

identified-content.person: CANNON, KAREN CHANTAL DE CANNART D'HAMALE (KAREN CHANTAL DE CANNART D'HAMALE PHALLE)

hedline.hl1: Karen Cannon, Marc de Saint Phalle

block.p: Karen Chantal de Cannart d'Hamale Cannon, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Paul J. Cannon of Ridgewood, N.J., was married yesterday to Marc Thibaut de Saint Phalle, the son of Elene de Saint Phalle of New York and Thibaut de Saint Phalle of Naples, Fla. The Rev. Georges F. de Laire performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Mount Carmel Roman Catholic Church in Tuxedo, N.Y.

Mrs. de Saint Phalle, 29, is a management consultant in New York for Bain & Company, the strategic consulting concern. She graduated from Georgetown University, received a master's degree in European studies from the Universite Catholique de Louvain in Louvain-la-Neuve, Belgium, and received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania.

Karen Chantal de Cannart d'Hamale Cannon, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Paul J. Cannon of Ridgewood, N.J., was married yesterday to Marc Thibaut de Saint Phalle, the son of Elene de Saint Phalle of New York and Thibaut de Saint Phalle of Naples, Fla. The Rev. Georges F. de Laire performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Mount Carmel Roman Catholic Church in Tuxedo, N.Y.

Mrs. de Saint Phalle, 29, is a management consultant in New York for Bain & Company, the strategic consulting concern. She graduated from Georgetown University, received a master's degree in European studies from the Universite Catholique de Louvain in Louvain-la-Neuve, Belgium, and received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania.

The bride's father is a cardiologist at the Columbia-Presbyterian Center of New York-Presbyterian Hospital, where he was the chief of cardiology until last July. He is also a professor of cardiology at the Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons in New York.

Mr. de Saint Phalle, 34, is a vice president at Bessemer Trust in New York, where he is the portfolio manager for its venture capital and buyout investment funds. He graduated from Duke University and received an M.B.A. from Columbia. His father is a financial consultant in Naples and the author of ''The Federal Reserve: An Intentional Mystery'' (Praeger Publishers, 1985).
